ai-tha-ap504:0.3_0: He then who only had a single layman, who was sometimes helped the senior,
ai-tha-ap504:1.1_0: At the foot of a tree
ai-tha-ap504:1.4_0: the undefiled ones who have crossed the flood.
ai-tha-ap504:2.1_0: if he has a clay bowl,
ai-tha-ap504:2.4_0: to the noble ones, upright and poised,
ai-tha-ap504:3.2_0: we obtain what they have thought.
ai-tha-ap504:3.3_0: You can carry poison in your eyes
ai-tha-ap504:6.1_0: This is your almsbowl for you,
ai-tha-ap504:6.2_0: I was my father of the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap504:6.4_0: in which the fruit will grow.
ai-tha-ap504:7.2_0: too, a group, and an accountants,
ai-tha-ap504:7.3_0: No-one can speak of the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap504:8.4_0: I’ve attained the state of grace.
ai-tha-ap504:9.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
ai-tha-ap504:9.4_0: This fruit will be the fruit.
ai-tha-ap504:10.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
ai-tha-ap504:12.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
ai-tha-ap504:13.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Dīgha Tapassī.
ai-tha-ap504:14.1_0: for a single senior mendicants who have reached the second part of the senior.
